dublinCore.dc:title: 109 HR 5874 IH: Transboundary Aquifer Assessment Program Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Ciscomani (for himself and Ms. Stansbury) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources

form.official-title: To amend the United States-Mexico Transboundary Aquifer Assessment Act to reauthorize the United States-Mexico transboundary aquifer assessment program.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Transboundary Aquifer Assessment Program Act or the TAAP Act.

section.header: Reauthorization of Transboundary Aquifer Assessment Program

subsection.text: Section 4(c)(2) of the United States-Mexico Transboundary Aquifer Assessment Act (42 U.S.C. 1962 note; Public Law 109–448) is amended by striking New Mexico or Texas and inserting New Mexico, Texas, or Arizona (other than an aquifer underlying Arizona and Sonora, Mexico, that is partially within the Yuma groundwater basin designated by the order of the Director of the Arizona Department of Water Resources dated June 21, 1984).

Section 8(a) of the United States-Mexico Transboundary Aquifer Assessment Act (42 U.S.C. 1962 note; Public Law 109–448) is amended by striking fiscal years 2007 through 2016 and inserting fiscal years 2025 through 2035.

Section 9 of the United States-Mexico Transboundary Aquifer Assessment Act (42 U.S.C. 1962 note; Public Law 109–448) is amended by striking enactment of this Act and inserting enactment of the Transboundary Aquifer Assessment Program Act.
